info.description:
**IMPORTANT:** This API specification is a work in progress, so until there is an official release, please bear in mind that this spec might change. Having said that, the DNB Developer team would love to hear your thoughts on the current specification. After all, that is why we are publishing it! So feel free to contact us at developer@dnb.no. 

**Sandbox only:** 
No APIs are currently publicly available in production - so all data returned from these endpoints are from a static sandbox environment containing *dummy data* only. We trying our best to get a dynamic sandbox and (of course) access to production available to you, but until then, enjoy the feeling of being able to initiate infinite payments without influencing your account balance.. Test customer SSNs can be found under `/testCustomers`.

**Authorization**
We use AWS signatures for tokens, with AWS Region `eu-west-1`. You can read more about how it works at AWS's own docs: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/sig-v4-authenticating-requests.html.

**General guidelines:**
* We use camelCase, starting with lowercase: ```customerEngagement```, ```accountNumber```, ```creditCard```, etc.
* Standards are mentioned and refered to, unless implicit by Swagger.
* General rule: The response (object) determines endpoint: If the response is ```account```, the endpoint should be under ```/accounts```. In cases where this may be up for discussion, multiple endpoints may, for a limited time, be available in order to evaluate.
* Versioning: Major.Minor.Patch (https://semver.org/). Major: Incompatible changes. Minor: New, backwards-compatible functionality. Patch: Backwards-compatible fixes. 

**HTTP Response Codes:**

HTTP response are intended to be logical: If a ```customer```or an ```account``` does not exist, the response is ```404 Not Found```.  All errors return a relevant HTTP status code and response with an ``error`` containing additional details. The HTTP statuses returned are:

Success

* ```200: OK``` Success!   
* ```201: Created``` Resource created. Reference included.
* ```204: No Content``` Success - but no content returned   

Client Error

* ```400: Bad Request``` Your request was, somehow, not ok.  
* ```401: Unauthorized``` You are unknown.   
* ```403: Forbidden``` We know who you are, but you are attempting something you are not allowed to.  
* ```404: Not Found``` What you looked for is not here.  
* ```429: Too Many Requests``` Settle down!

Server Error

* ```500: Server Error``` We screwed up, sorry!
* ```501: Not Implemented``` The operation is not (yet) implemented. 
* ```503: Service Unavailable``` Something is very wrong.
* ```504: Timeout``` We need to speed up internally!

**Github**

Both our swagger documentation and the test data is available on Github: https://github.com/DNBbank/

**Contact DNB Open Banking**

You reach the entire team at developer@dnb.no. We do our best to reply as quickly as possible, and would love to hear from you!
info.title: DNB Developer APIs

get.description:
The are ten *completely fictitious* test customers are available in our Sandbox, with the following SSNs:

**Note:** This is currently not a functioning endpoint - we're working on getting it up and running!

|  | SSN | Customer Name |
| -------- | -------- | -------- |
| 1. | 29105573083          | Liv Ødegård     |
| 2. | 18052903871          | Astrid Ruud     |
| 3. | 08096203957          | Thor Knudsen     |
| 4. | 15025498515          | Øyvind Hansen     |
| 5. | 15047232429          | Siri Strand     |
| 6. | 01103068170          | John Aune     |
| 7. | 22121810569          | Sverre Jørgensen    |
| 8. | 15099564713          | Karl Myhre     |
| 9. | 12034802382          | Dag Andreassen     |
| 10. | 10016956239         | Camilla Andresen    |

Each customer have accounts, balances and due payments so now all they're looking for is someone who wants to play around with their data.

Use one of these SSNs when calling `Get API token` to get a token in return associated with that customer only. Using this token when calling other APIs will return data for that given test customer.

**Note**: These customers, along with all their associated data are *entirely fictitious* generated from test scripts residing at https://github.com/DNBbank/dnbtestdata. If you'd like to improve the scripts, nothing makes us more happy than a pull request!

Returning a JWT token representing the end-consumer. You need this token for calling the `Customer`,` Accounts`, `Transactions`, `Cards` and `Payments` APIs. Find test customer SSNs under `/testCustomers`.

**Authorization: AWS Signature v.4**
We use AWS Signatures v.4 for authorization, with AWS region `eu-west-1`. If you're using Postman, the authorization header will be automatically generated when you send the request. For detailed information, we recommend [AWS's own documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/sig-v4-authenticating-requests.html).  

**Tip for Postman users:** 
After having generated the token, store it as a global variable to avoid having to update the JWT token for each API.

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description:
One or more SSNs of the customer to obtain token(s) for. Multiple SSNs to be specified as comma separated list without whitespace.
Example: /api/token?customerId={type:'SSN', value:'4238934242'}

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: App key from DNB Developer

parameters.name: x-dnbapi-jwt
parameters.description: Your JWT Token generated from Get API Token

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API key from your app page in DNB Developer

get.description:
A` transaction` is a conducted payment to or from a specific account.

This API retrives the last transactions on an account.

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Filter for start date (included)

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: Filter for end date (included).

parameters.name: x-dnbapi-jwt
parameters.description: The JWT Token generated from Get API Token

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API key from your app page in DNB Developer

post.description:
Initiate a domestic payment going directly from a DNB account with KID or message. Also allows for transfers (payments between accounts held by the same owner). The recieving account can be in whichever bank, but for domestic payments it has to be a Norwegian one.

Accepts a ```paymentInitiation``` POST, and returns HTTP 201 with the ```PaymentId``` of the successfully created ```payment```.

***Note**: As our sandbox is currently static, initiating payments unfortuntately won't reflect in neither the balance nor lastest transactions of the account. While we are working hard to get you a dynamic sandbox, you may in the meanwhile look at it as finally having that infinite account never getting affected by your purchases.*

parameters.name: x-dnbapi-jwt
parameters.description: The JWT Token generated from Get API Token

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API key from your app page in DNB Developer

schema.description: Returning id of the new payment

delete.description:
Delete a due payment for an DNB account. To list the due payments, head over to *Get due payments*.

**Note:** As our sandbox is currently static, deleting payments will not update the list of due payments in the Sandbox. The reason we are still making the APIs available is to allow for testing of responses and such while readying the dynamic sandbox for you.

parameters.name: x-dnbapi-jwt
parameters.description: The JWT Token generated from Get API Token

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: e API key from your app page in DNB Developer

204.description: Gone forever! No further information needed or provided.

patch.description:
Update a due payment on an accont. A due ```payment``` can be updated until its due date, by changing one of the following parameters:
* Date 
* Amount
* Status (deactivate, reactivate)

Returns the updated ```payment```.

*Note: As our sandbox is currently static, deleting payments will not update the list of due payments in the Sandbox. The reason we are still making the APIs available is to allow for testing of responses and such while readying the dynamic sandbox for you.*

parameters.name: x-dnbapi-jwt
parameters.description: The JWT Token generated from Get API Token

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API key from your app page in DNB Developer

200.description: Payment updated. (Note: This was previously ```HTTP 201 Created```, but since the payment was already created before this request, it is now ```HTTP 200 OK```)

get.summary: Get due payments for an account
get.description: A due payment is a `payment` scheduled to be deducted from an account in the future. It can be updated or deleted until its' due date.

parameters.name: x-dnbapi-jwt
parameters.description: The JWT Token generated from Get API Token

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API key from your app page in DNB Developer

get.summary: Get due payment by payment id
get.description:
A due payment is a `payment` that is scheduled to be deducted from an account. It can be changed untill its due date, by using update or delete payment

This API retrieves the details of a specific `due payment`. complete with with ```paymentDetails```.

parameters.name: x-dnbapi-jwt
parameters.description: The JWT Token generated from Get API Token

parameters.name: x-api-key

***Note**: This API is not yet available in our sandbox - we are working to get it up and running as soon as possible.*

***Note**: This API is not yet available in our sandbox - we are working to get it up and running as soon as possible.*

Returns the balance of a card, if available.

parameters.name: x-dnbapi-jwt

parameters.name: cardId
parameters.description: The unique id of the card. Note that this is not the same as what is printed on a card, but an ID which can be fetched from Get card list.

put.description:
**Note:** This API endpoint is not yet available in our sandbox. We're working to get it out as soon as possible!

This API enables the end-customer to block a debit or credit card (not including Cresco Cards). To block means to not stop payments of going through on a card.

parameters.name: x-dnbapi-jwt
parameters.description: The JWT Token generated from Get API Token

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API key from your app page in DNB Developer

put.description:
**Note:** This API endpoint is not yet available in our sandbox. We're working to get it out as soon as possible!

This API enables the end-customer to unblock a card having a so-called "soft block", i.e. where `cardStatus` is `Blocked` and `unblockAllowed` is `true`. This will change that status of the card to `Unblocked`.

parameters.name: x-dnbapi-jwt
parameters.description: The JWT Token generated from Get API Token

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API key from your app page in DNB Developer

parameters.name: toCurrency
parameters.description: ISO 4217: alpha 3-letter upcase e.g ```NOK```. This is the currency we are converting the amount _to_.

parameters.name: fromCurrency
parameters.description: ISO 4217: alpha 3-letter upcase e.g ```NOK```. This is the currency we are converting the amount _from_.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount for the ```fromCurrency```.

get.description:
Returns a list of currency rates for the most common currencies, for the specified base currency. 

**NOTE**: The source data is based on NOK as the base currency. Any other base currency requires different source data, which is currently not available.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Not yet implemented.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API key from your app page in DNB Developer

parameters.name: toCurrency
parameters.description:
ISO 4217: alpha 3-letter upcase e.g ```NOK```. This is the currency we are converting the amount _to_. 

The response will contain a list of currency rates for various currencies, converted to the ```toCurrency```. If ```toCurrency```is ```NOK```, the list will contain a list of ```currencyRate```s for ```EUR```, ```USD```, ```GBP```, etc converted into ```NOK```.

get.description:
Convert amount from one currency to another - just like a currency calcuator. Note that this API is only available in Sandbox for now, meaning that the currencies returned are not updated.


**NOTE**: The source data is based on NOK as the base currency. Because of this, one of the currencies (base or quote) _must be_ NOK. Conversion between any two currencies requires different source data, which is currently not available.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API key from your app page in DNB Developer

get.summary: Get list of all DNB branches

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API key from your app page in DNB Developer

get.summary: Get list of all DNB ATMs

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API key from your app page in DNB Developer

get.description:
**NOTE:** Currently uses _aerial distance_ only, not distance using roads, etc.

Returns an array of ```branches```, as there may be more than one branch that is "the nearest".

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API key from your app page in DNB Developer

get.description:
**NOTE:** Currently uses _aerial distance_ only, not distance using roads, etc.

Returns an array of ```atm```, as there may be more than one ATM that is "the nearest".

parameters.name: x-api-key

get.description: Contact information, opening hours, etc for a specific branch. See ```/locations/branches``` for getting all ```branches``` and their ids.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API key from your app page in DNB Developer

parameters.name: branchid
parameters.description: Id of branch

get.description:
**NOTE:** Not planned for the first phase. See ```/locations/branches``` and ```/locations/Atms```. Needs an ```address```(or smiliar data) as a ```POST``` request.

Returns an array of ```branches```, as there may be more than one branch that is "the nearest".

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: For now: Assume geocoding functionality similar to Google Maps: https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/geocoding/intro

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API key from your app page in DNB Developer

SSN.description: The SSN of a test customer

testCustomers.description: The test customers available in our sandbox. Currently not in any endpoint, but will be implemented shortly.

customerPublidId.description: The ID value of the customer in question

tokenInfo.description: A token representing the end-consumer of the API.

customerId.description: SSN (11 digits) or organization number (9 digits).

firstName.description: First name. May be used for the contact person if type is ```PERSON```.

lastName.description: Surname. May be used for the contact person if type is ```PERSON```.

phone.description: Including "+" and international prefix. E.164: https://www.twilio.com/docs/glossary/what-e164 Whitespace and dashes are stripped.

customerType.description:
```PERSON```, ```COMPANY``` are expected values
For release 1 PERSON will be hardcoded

companyName.description:
Out of scope for release 1

Company name, if type is ```COMPANY```.

customer.description: One common ```customer```data object for all kinds of customers. A customer may have one or more ```customerEngagement```s.

accountInterestDetails.description: Details about an the interest for an ```account```.

IBAN.description: ISO 13616:2007: https://www.iso.org/standard/41031.html No whitespace. Enjoy the regex.

accountDetails.description:
Details for an ```account```, with optional reference to ```accountDetails```.

IBAN help: http://www.xe.com/ibancalculator/sample/?ibancountry=norway

Possible regex for IBAN:

debetCardExists.description: Whether the given account has an associated debet card

accountAlias.description: The name of the account, set by the customer

accountCategory.description: Category of account. Will be 'DEPOSIT' for debet accounts and 'LOAN' for credit accounts.

accountCurrency.description: Currency of the account defined by ISO 4217

withdrawalAllowed.description: Can this account be withdrawn money from?

productName.description: The type of account. Most common types include 'BRUKSKONTO', 'SPAREKONTO', 'BRUKSKONTO TILLEGG', 'RAMMELÅN', 'LÅN' and 'BSU'.

transferToAllowed.description: Can you transfer to this account?

paymentFromAllowed.description: Can you make a payment to another person from this account?

transferFromAllowed.description: Can you make a transfer among your own accounts from this account?

standingOrderExists.description: Is there a standing order (recurring payment) on this account?

countryOfAccountOwnerPublicId.description: Country of the owners public ID defined by ISO 3166-2

accountOwnerName.description: Name of the owner of the account

account.description:
Same ```account``` data object is used for all types of accounts. The ```type``` property determines the type. 

An ```account``` may have ```accountDetails```, which may again have ```accountBalance``` and  ```accountInterestDetails```. 

**Format**

A Norwegian ```account```has three groups: xxxx yy zzzzc. Excample: 8601 11 17947.

* xxxx: Bank register number, identifying bank and branch. 
* yy: Account group. 
* zzzz: Customer account number.  
* c: Control digit, modulo 11 with weight number 5432765432.

More details: https://www.ecbs.org/iban/norway-bank-account-number.html

balance.description: The current balance of a debit account or credit card. Does not take into account due payments, and is not a "safe to spend" amount. For credit cards, it does not include the credit gotten from the bank.

creditLimit.description: The credit limit represents how much can be credited (lent from) the credit card in question.

balance.description: Common data object used by both ```account```and  ```card```. The available balance of a card, not taking into account the due payments on the account.

originalCurrency.description: If not the currency of the account/card.

status.description: Booked, reserved, and, if this is to be merged with ```payment```: Completed (or something similar, to indicate that this has, in fact, been processed and finalized)

description.example: Lunch at The Restaurant at the End of the Universe

merchantName.description: Name of merchant. With a merhant register, this could be replaced with a (for now, non-existant) ```merchantId```.

kid.description: Merge with ```message```? Merge with ```kid```? See also ```paymentInitiation```and ```payment```.

transaction.description:
A ```transaction``` is a completed operation between two accounts, in contrast to ```payment```, which is planned, but not completed.

The same ```transaction``` is used for all types of transactions: DNB-only account transactions, domestic transactions, international transactions, card transactions, etc. Some transaction types have more fields and data than others. A developer does not need to know about different transaction types when retrieving them, this is .

type.description: The payment type: KID, message or transfer. A transfer is a payment between two accounts with the same owner, a message is an outgoing payment with just a descriptive message and KID is a payment with a KID (customer identification) number.

message.description: Used for both KID and Message, based on Type.

paymentInitiation.description:
The payment initiation object can be used for three types of payments, which should be specified in the ```type``` property:
* ```KID```: The customer identification number specified by the recieving end, often described in the invioce. 
* ```MESSAGE```: A payment just having a text message attached with it.
* ```TRANSFER```: A payment going between two DNB accounts having the same owner. 

Not including the "straksbetaling" (imediate payment) flag, as this will be the default.

Payment initiator: Part of the context object, but kept here too for reference.

paymentDetails.description: More details about a payment. Some payment types have more data than others.

type.description: The payment type: KID, message or transfer. A transfer is a payment between two accounts with the same owner, a message is an outgoing payment with just a descriptive message and KID is a payment with a KID (customer identification) number.

created.description: The creation point of a payment

payment.description:
**NOTE:** May be completely merged with ```transaction```.

A ```payment``` is a planned payment/transaction that has not yet been carried out.

TODO: There is no ```message```or ```kid```, as in ```paymentInitiation```and ```transaction```. Check this.

Details about a payment. Used by:
* /payments/due/{accountNumber}: Returning a list of payments, with _empty_ PaymentDetails
* /payments/due/{accountNumber}/details: Returning a list of payments, with PaymentDetails

maskedCardNumber.description: The masked card number (what's printed on your actual card), but only displaying the four last digits.

customerId.description: The id of the card holder

cardHolderName.description: The name of the card holder

productName.description: The product group of the card

accountNumber.description: The account number that the card is linked to

performedBy.description: Who made the change (B - bank/C - customer)

timestamp.description: Timestamp of the action performed as defined by ISO 8601

blockAllowed.description: Can the card be blocked by the customer?

unblockAllowed.description: Can the card be unblocked by the customer?

lastChanged.description: When was the last change on the card

currencyRate.description: Response structure for different exchange rates based on base currency.

openingTimes.description:
Opening times for a ```branch```, ```ATM```, or something else.

If open 24 hours, ```openingTime``` is "00:00" and ```closingTime``` is "24:00".

address.description:
Corresponds with address fields used internally in DNB. 

```
(Name from parent object)
Dronning Eufemias gate 30
c/o CEO office
0191 Oslo
NO
```

description.description: May be used for large areas like airports, train stations, stadiums, etc.

location.description: Data object for physical location based on GPS coordinates. May be used for something that does not have a specific address, or somethjing that needs a more specific than an address provides, such as an ```ATM``` at a train station. A ```location``` may be used in addition to an ```address```.

errorDocumentation.description: URI to developer documentation for this error.

errorDetails.description: Details about the cause of this error (or errors). May contain information about an invalid parameter, or another specific problem.

headerLinks.description:
URIs for previous, this and next. Only ```self``` is required, as previous and next may not exist.

See also the pagination headers: ```pageNumber```and ```pageSize```.
